Name: Fragment of painted relief from a tomb wall
Description: Fragment of painted plaster, from a tomb-chapel wall, with part of a column of hieroglyphic text comprising highly detailed signs, reading from right to left. Three traces of signs are visible: above, the lower part of the throne hieroglyph, and below, on the right the top of the reed hieroglyph denoting a glottal stop before i, and on the left the head of the owl sign which denotes the sound m.
